oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Alan Jackson Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Alan Jackson (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Alan Jackson; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Alan Jackson expresses his appreciation for "Ace of Hearts" writers Carson Chamberlain, Ron Moore, and Lonnie Wilson -- (00:23) Jackson reflects on "Ace of Hearts" being the up-tempo song in the album to break from the large number of ballads -- (00:53) Collie has Jackson reflect on why he chose "Here in the Real World" to be the title track -- (01:33) Collie introduces Jackson and Jackson gives his background information -- (02:35) Collie introduces "Blue Blooded Woman" and Jackson reflects on writing with Roger Murrah and Keith Stegall -- (03:28) Collie has Jackson pick a George Jones song, and Jackson chooses the Grand Tour -- (04:01) Collie introduces Jackson's album and Collie and Jackson reflect on Jackson growing up in Newnan, Georgia with his four sisters -- (05:20) Jackson tells that football is his favorite sport -- (05:55) "Wanted" is reveal by Jackson to be inspired by a scene with John Wayne and a wanted poster -- (06:46) "Chasin' That Neon Rainbow" is told by Collie as a track that reminds him of clubs; Jackson reveals "Chasin' That Neon Rainbow" is based on his live performances -- (08:28) Jackson reflects on Vern Gosdin and the power of "If You're Gonna Do Me Wrong (Do It Right)" -- (08:55) Collie and Jackson express their delight in Gosdin's recent success -- (09:19) Collie and Jackson discuss how Jackson is the first country artist to sign with Arista Records -- (09:41) "She Don't Get the Blues" is revealed to be about a women who had her heart broken too many times -- (10:13) Jackson reveals his first public performance to probably be when he performed a play in church -- (11:34) Collie and Jackson discuss how Jackson moved to Nashville to pursue his musical career -- (12:08) Jackson recalls writing "I'd Love You All Over Again" for his wife -- (12:44) Collie has Jackson reflect on Hank Williams; Jackson reveals he did not know about Williams when he was younger -- (13:47) Collie introduces Jackson's album and Jackson reflects on why he chose to sing country over other genres -- (14:42) "Dog River Blues" is discussed by Jackson to be about an actual river from his hometown -- (15:29) Collie and Jackson discuss how to remember Jackson's hometown Coweta -- (16:03) "Home" is reflected on as a story about his family after he moved to Nashville -- (17:19) Jackson and Collie discuss how Jackson originally would work on other people's band; Jackson would always perform "Rose Colored Glasses" -- (18:01) Collie has Jackson reflect on the support he has received from his wife -- (18:59) "Short Sweet Ride" is a song revealed by Jackson to have not followed the original design -- (19:50) Collie questions Jackson's hosting history -- (20:34) Collie has Jackson say his goodbye statement
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Alan; Jackson, Alan, 1957-; Jackson, Alan, 1958-; Collie, Biff;
